item.description:
Bring Your Own Fruit to The 20h Annual EarthFest, sponsored by Radio 92.9 and Whole Foods Market, on Saturday May 18, 2013 at the Hatch Shell in Boston. The Radio 92.9 EarthFest is usually the largest free radio station concert in Boston. The event is produced in conjunction with the Massachusetts Department of Conservation and Recreation. Past events have drawn in excess of 100,000 people. http://www.celebrateboston.com/earthfest.htm

Music on the main stage usually starts at 11:30 am, and the event will feature performances by Camper Van Beethoven, Gentlemen Hall, Fastball, Cracker, and Vertical Horizon. The festival will also feature exhibits and environmental displays, staffed by sponsors and non-profit environmental organizations from New England. Each exhibitor is committed to raising awareness and offering educational information about different environmental issues facing the planet. http://www.myradio929.com/earthfest.aspx

In addition to the musical performances on the main stage, the 2013 Radio 92.9 EarthFest will also feature once again The Kids Planet—an expanded interactive family area. The Kids Planet will feature a wide variety of musical acts and entertainment as well as environmental activities and educational displays. Musical performers will include RymeZwell, Vanessa Trien, Sarah Wheeler, and performers from ZUMiX. Additional activities in The Kids Planet range from face painting to healthy treats, compliments of Whole Foods Market and a variety of other vendors.

Numerous booths onsite will offer educational displays, exhibits and food sampling. The booths will be staffed by event sponsors and local environmental and non-profit organizations.

Read Articles about Radio 929 EarthFest's 2012, 2011, 2010, and 2009.

PLEASE NOTE THAT NEW SECURITY PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE FOR 2013. THE FIEDLER FOOTBRIDGE IS CLOSED DURING THE EVENT. ACCESS TO THE ESPLANADE IS VIA THE FOOTBRIDGE AT CAMBRIDGE STREET OR AT DARTMOUTH STREET. LARGE BACKPACKS OR BAGS WILL NOT BE ALLOWED. ALL BAGS ARE SUBJECT TO SEARCH BY SECURITY PERSONNEL. PARKING IS NOT ALLOWED ON STORROW DRIVE. NOTE THAT SIMILAR PROCEDURES WERE PREVALENT YEARS AGO WHEN PEOPLE WOULD ATTEMPT TO BRING ALCOHOL TO THE ESPLANADE. PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY AND BE COURTEOUS. THE FESTIVAL OPENS AT 10:00 AM.

 

Main Stage Performers (approximate times)

11:30 am - 11:55 am — Camper Van Beethoven
12:00 pm - 12:45 pm — Gentlemen Hall
01:15 pm - 02:00 pm — Fastball
02:30 pm - 03:15 pm — Cracker
03:45 pm - 04:45 pm — Vertical Horizon

 

Kids Planet Performers

10:00 am - 3:45 pm

Zumix
Mister G
RhymeZweLL
Sarah Wheeler and Little Groove
Mister G
Vanessa Trien
item.how_to_find_us: Please contact people who RSVP "Yes" to set up a meeting spot and time.
item.name: "Fruitnic" @ EarthFest
